abstract.text: The fundamental base type of anything which can be represented as SQL using SQLKit.

Here is an example of implementing a trivial (and somewhat pointless)

code: public func serialize(to serializer: inout SQLSerializer) {

inlineContent.text: The example expression above treats the type of the “subexpression” it contains generically; this is
currently considered best practice whenever possible. However, this pattern is unfortunately
by any of the expressions included in SQLKit itself - instead, the existential type
used with great abandon. This is, to say the least, not optimal, but as usual with pre-existing public API,
it cannot be changed until the next major version bump. The API in its present form was designed back when
Swift 5.1 was the current release; the language features needed to usefully handle expressions generically
were largely absent before Swift 5.7, and even then it would have been severely limited before the advent of
Swift 5.9 and support for variadic generics.

to be converted to an
on the same schema which performs the column updates specified by the associated column assignments and,
where supported by the database, constrained by the associated predicate. The column assignments may

expressions to refer to values which would have been inserted into the row
if the conflict had not taken place.
A call to a function available in SQL, expressed as a name and a (possibly empty) list of arguments.
An abstract definition of a specific dialect of SQL.
The common interface to SQLKit for both drivers and client code.
An expression representing one of the six supported query union operations.
A fundamental syntactical expression - a left and right operand joined by an infix operator.
An expression representing a
query. Used to create new tables.
Specifies ordering for a trigger relative to another trigger.
Simple helper for working around MySQL’s refusal to implement standard SQL. Only emits SQL when needed.
Specifies a conflict resolution strategy and associated conditions for an
query.
An
with a conflict strategy is often refered to as an
(“insert or update”).
Databases are not required to support any given subset of upsert functionality, or any at all.
A complete
constraint specification.
Serialize an arbitrary
using the database’s dialect.
An expression representing an
query. Used to add new rows to a table.
SQLKit is a library for building and serializing SQL queries in Swift.
An expression representing a
query. Used to add indexes over columns to an existing table.
Specifies an event which causes a trigger to execute.
A “nested subpath” expression is used to descend into the “deeper” structure of a non-scalar value,
such as a dictionary, array, or JSON value.
An expression which wraps a
query in a
in order to form a syntactically
valid subquery expression.
A pair of expressions, one describing a query sort key and the other a directionality for that key.
An alternative API for serialization of

which constructs SQL of the form
Encapsulates a single SQL
, specifying the join type, the right-side table, and condition.
Specifies whether a trigger executes for each row affected by an event or once for each triggering statement.
An expression consisting of an array of constituent subexpressions generated by custom string interpolations.
Represents a data type which specifies an enumeration in the database.
An expression representing two or more
queries joined by
clauses. Used to merge the results of
multiple queries into a single result set.
An SQL locking clause.
A trivial copy of
with a different type for its subquery property.
Specifies how a trigger executes relative to the event that triggers it.
An expression representing a
query. Used to create new triggers for actions on a table.
Specifies the deferability of a contraint trigger vis a vis the associated constraint.
The fundamental base type of anything which can be represented as SQL using SQLKit.
A clause representing a group of one or more
s.
An expression representing a
query. Used to retrieve rows and expression results from a database.
A fundamental syntactical expression - a quoted identifier (also often referred to as a “name” or “object name”).
An expression representing a
query. Used to delete indexes from tables.
Invoked when a request is made to serialize the expression to raw SQL.
An expression representing an optionally second-level-qualified SQL table.
An expression representing the combination of a constraint name and algorithm for table constraints.
An expression representing a
query. Used to delete triggers.
Represents a value’s type in SQL.
Specifies a behavior when performing a
operation on a database object which is referenced by other objects.
An expression (usually an
) giving the character(s) used to quote SQL
identifiers, such as table and column names.
An expression representing a
query. Used to delete entire tables.
An expression representing a
query. Used to delete enumeration types.
A clause expressing a column definition, for use when creating and altering tables.
The method used by a table join clause.
An expression representing a
query. Used to remove rows from a table.
An expression representing a
query. Used to create enumeration types.
A fundamental syntactical expression - a list of subexpresions with a specified “separator” subexpression.
Table-level data constraints.
Encapsulates the most basic operations for serializing
s into a raw SQL string and a
(potentially empty) sequence of bound parameter values.
A clause describing a single Common Table Expressions, which in itws simplest form provides
additional data to a primary query in the same way as joining to a subquery.
Encapsulates a
expression in the context of an
query’s value
assignment list. This is distinct from an
using the

, and the right side may use
when the assignment appears in

specification.
A clause specifying a new data type to be applied to an existing column.
A parameterizied value bound to the SQL query.
A fundamental syntactical expression - an arbitrary string of raw SQL with no escaping or formating of any kind.
An expression representing an
query. Used to add new cases to enumeration types.
An expression representing the subexpression of an aggregate function call which specifies whether the aggregate
groups over all result rows or only distinct rows.
An expression representing an
query. Used to modify the structure of existing tables.
An expression specifying a behavior for a foreign key constraint violation.
A clause describing a list of values to be returned from a data-modifying query.
An expression representing an
query. Used to modify existing rows in a single table.
A fundamental syntactical expression - one of several various kinds of literal SQL expressions.
A fundamental syntactical expression - an arbitrary expression or list of expressions, surroudned by parenthesis.
Column-level data constraints.
An expression appearing on the right side of a column assignment which, when the assignment list
is part of an upsert’s update acion, refers to the value which was originally to be inserted for
the given column.
Encapsulates SQL’s
syntax, most often used to declare aliaed names
for columns and tables.
SQL binary expression operators.
Describes an ordering direction for a given sorting key.
An expression representing an optionally table-qualified column in an SQL table.
